title: Work Schedule
description: This simple work day schedule allows the user to input an entry on a given timeslot of their day. Using moment.js I was able to show the current date and display timeblocks. Entries could be saved to localstorage as well as deleted. I did a bit of CSS styling to this app, but primarily built the page using jquery and javascript to dynamically build it.

title: Weather Dashboard
description: This weather dashboard utilizes the OpenWeatherMap API to obtain comprehensive weather information such as the city's name, date, weather icon, temperature, humidity, and wind speed. It includes a search history and a 5-day forecast, allowing for easy access to previous searches. It dynamically creates the cards using jquery and fetch method to obtain data from the OpenWeather API.

title: Team Profile Generator
description: This app involved me building an command-line app using Node.js to generate a HTML page that renders a number of cards with employee information depending on the answers I provide in the command-line questions

title: Coding Quiz App
description: This is a quiz app built with 5 questions about the fundamentals of javascipt. There is a 30 second timer with 5 seconds deducted everytime an incorrect answer is chosen. The highscore can be recorded and stored in localstorage

title: My Fridge App
description: This project involved me working in a team to build a app that was able to render the page components from javascript dynamically as well as obtain data from at least 2 APIs. In this particular app, we used two APIs, CalorieNinja & Edamame to obtain recipe and nutritional data.

title: Professional Readme Generator
description: Havaing a readme file is an important part of coding, and in this command-lin app built with node.js and javascript, I was able to generate and render a professional readme file using a template after answering a series of questions.

title: My Fridge App
description: This project involved me working in a team to build a app that was able to render the page components from javascript dynamically as well as obtain data from at least 2 APIs. In this particular app, we used two APIs, CalorieNinja & Edamame to obtain recipe and nutritional data.

title: CGM Project
description: I created a personal website using HTML and CSS, deployed on AWS S3. I automated the deployment with a CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions and integrated AWS Lambda to test the deploymentâ€™s integrity, ensuring only the latest files are live on S3. A great hands-on project in automation and serverless architecture!
technologies: HTML | CSS | AWS S3 | AWS LAMBDA

title: Code 'n' Coffee
description: I worked on a group project to create an interactive Python CLI coffee store. Users can interact with prompts and choose from various options. The app saves their selections and displays their final order at the end. It was a fun project that helped me hone my skills in Python and collaborative development!
